profile_description:
Mark Ruffalo
A husband, father, actor, director, and a climate justice and renewable energy advocate with an eye out for love and hope. Please, enjoy my photos.
linktr.ee/markruffalo

posts.description: Benny, you stand out in a crowd! Happy Birthday!

I know this young person (mangoes, mullet, and all) would’ve gotten vaccinated, but we’ve got to get other young people protected as well. Who else is willing to help? 👋🏻 (check the link in my bio for a resource)

Inspired by @potus.

Congratulations to my birthday twin, Scarlett Johansson & everyone a part of #BlackWidow for a great opening weekend! Have you seen the film yet? No spoilers, but let me know what you thought of the movie 🕷

Communities across the country mobilized to get @POTUS elected, and we’ve  joined forces once again to demand he follow through on his campaign promises.

Today we stand with the hundreds of water protectors like Sasha Beaulieu of Red Lake camp, Taysha Martineau from camp Migizi, and Nedahness Greene who goes wherever she is needed to stop #Line3 in Northern MN. They are a part — at the heart — of a movement that is growing in spirit and power for the future we all want to create.

Today, more than 200 actors, musicians, environmentalists, donors, and allied activists (including @100isnow grantees, @giniwcollective, @honortheeearth, & RISE Coalition) to deliver a letter to the White House calling on the Biden administration and the @USACEHQ to respect Indigenous and Tribal rights and to take bold climate action, and #StopLine3 before it is too late.

Read our letter with the link in my bio and join the fight to protect our communities and our climate.

Photo credit to @nedahnessgreene.

Communities across the country mobilized to get @POTUS elected, and we’ve joined forces again to demand he follow through on his campaign promises. Read our letter (link in bio) calling on @joebiden & @USACEHQ to respect Indigenous rights, act on climate, & #StopLine3.
Happy birthday to the maestro of magic himself, @wongrel! ✨

For too long Indigenous communities have carried the weight of our addiction to oil & gas despite their objections. We MUST show up for Indigenous, Black, communities of color & allies fighting to protect water, food sources, ancestral land, the sky and their bodies from toxic pollution and climate change.

TODAY (June 26th) at 1:30pm ET, join me here on Instagram Live with @100isnow’s CEO & President, @GloriaWalton alongside @WinonaLaDuke, executive director, and co-founder of @HonorTheEarth, for a conversation with a water protector directly impacted by the pipelines, who are fighting for our water, and for our futures.

#StopLine3 #BuildBackFossilFree #WaterIsLife #ClimateChange #ActOnClimate #HonortheTreaties #TarSands #BuildBackFossilFree #riverlife #ginamccarthy
Happy Birthday, Larry Kramer. You are missed. You taught us how to fight.
